steps: Check parent process of PowerShell execution
Look for obfuscation (Base64, -EncodedCommand, IEX)
Correlate with user account activity
Identify repeated failed logins from the same source IP
Check if login attempts succeeded later
Correlate with geographic location or impossible travel
Check for LSASS process access
Verify if non-system processes are dumping credentials
Correlate with privilege escalation attempts
Review DLL paths loaded by rundll32.exe
Check command-line arguments for suspicious exports
Trace execution back to parent process
Identify newly installed or modified services
Validate the binary path and signatures
Check persistence attempts
Look for '-EncodedCommand' arguments
Decode Base64 strings for review
Correlate with outbound network activity
Check destination IP reputation
Look for periodic beaconing patterns
Identify the process initiating the connection
Check new scheduled task creation events
Verify task name and binary paths
Identify persistence or lateral movement indicators
Check if macros were enabled by the user
Identify spawned processes (e.g., powershell.exe, cmd.exe)
Correlate with recent phishing email delivery
Check for unusual RDP sessions from external IPs
Validate if account usage is legitimate
Correlate with failed login attempts or credential dumps
